content: Singapore government ministry The **Ministry of Defence** (**MINDEF**; [Malay](/wiki/Malay_language): *Kementerian Pertahanan*; [Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 新加坡國防部; [Tamil](/wiki/Tamil_language): தற்காப்பு அமைச்சு) is a [ministry](/wiki/Ministry_(government_department)) under the [Government of Singapore](/wiki/Government_of_Singapore) responsible for overseeing the [national defence](/wiki/National_security) of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ## History MINDEF, together with the [Ministry of Home Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(Singapore)), was created on 11 August 1970 by splitting up the then [Ministry of Interior and Defence](/wiki/Ministry_of_Interior_and_Defence). ## Responsibilities MINDEF's mission is to "enhance Singapore's peace and security through deterrence and diplomacy, and should these fail, to secure a swift and decisive victory over the aggressor." It has a policy of *[Total Defence](/wiki/Total_Defence_(Singapore))* which consists of Military Defence, Civil Defence, Economic Defence, Social Defence, Psychological Defence and Digital Defence involving the people, public and private sectors of the country. ## Organisational structure MINDEF has one statutory board, the [Defence Science and Technology Agency](/wiki/Defence_Science_and_Technology_Agency) (DSTA). The [Singapore Armed Forces](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces) (SAF), which consists of the [Singapore Army](/wiki/Singapore_Army), the [Republic of Singapore Navy](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Navy) (RSN), the [Republic of Singapore Air Force](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force) (RSAF), and the [Digital and Intelligence Service](/wiki/Digital_and_Intelligence_Service) (DIS), is a military component of MINDEF. The [Security and Intelligence Division](/wiki/Security_and_Intelligence_Division) (SID), the foreign [intelligence service](/wiki/Intelligence_service) of Singapore, is autonomous within the ministry. ## Ministers The Ministry is headed by the **Minister for Defence** (**Minister for Interior and Defence** from 1965 to 1970), who is appointed as part of the [Cabinet of Singapore](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore).
